Yes but the update client problem here is that Eclipse Update manager is "inoperable" if one or more webservers returns a 404.

The Update manage should be robust enough to alert the user but continue with the update process by skipping this update date from the list.

It has not been possible to update any packages because the GMF project update site is down/move/incorrect in the config.  That is the bug here.


Ideally a red error decorater should be used to mark this failure in the resulting available updates list (and this item should not be selectable).  But I think the resulting list only displays available update (i.e. there is no list all option).



Bug Cloned due to lack of REOPEN function on Eclipse Bugzilla.

GMF is showing a "Not Installed Properly" in Manage Configuration - however, all sub elements are showing fine.

I'm running Linux RH FC5 on a P4 2.8GHz HT with 2Gb
